text: In Note XXXVI, Yakov claims to send his other 36 poems in a bottle down the river (R273/E216).
In his "How Sokolov's Mezhdu Sobakoj i volkom Is Made," Boguslawski suggested that the book cointains 37 Notes as an allusion to the year of Pushkin's death, 1837.
Latin: something written after the main thing.
suffix: Увы нам, наш климат для нас

text: Wind rose — a meteorological tool and predecessor of the compass rose used to show wind speed. Pictured here: ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/0/06/Wind_rose.jpg)
Colloquial: to disappear.
prefix:
жги и развей мои строчки.
  Как

text: Literary: once, at some point.

As Ostanin writes, "Amztarakhan (more correct Ashtarakhan, Aztarakan) — the capital of the Astrakhanskii khanate, which arose during the disintegration of the Golden Horde, located not far from the Itil'" (27). According to Boguslawski, "old Tatar names of today's Astrakhan" ("Annotations" 236).

A Tatar — a person from Tatarstan (now the Republic of Tatarstan), a speaker of a Tatar language. The Tatar Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic was forcibly established in 1920 and lasted throughout the Soviet period.
Low: horde, gang.
Roach. Animal motif.
suffix:
,
  Что пасся у хана в косицах;

text: Prints in the snow.
Runners — the pieces of a sled that provide support on either side.
Elk. Pictured here: ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/8/8b/Moose_superior.jpg) Animal motif.

highlighted:
пропали труды
  Народов и сами народы
text: Like the prints in the snow that fade away, so, too, do the things left behind by peoples and cultures. This is the opposite of Pushkin's message in his famous 1836 poem "Exegi Monumentum." Read it in the original and in an English translation [here](https://ruverses.com/alexander-pushkin/exegi-monumentum/1945/). Indeed, Yakov's apparent invitation to burn his verses will similarly be reversed at the end of the Note.
Colloquial: a small bottle of vodka. Alcohol theme.
A reference to Hamlet's famous monologue. Read a Russian translation [here](https://www.culture.ru/poems/13864/byt-ili-ne-byt-monolog-gamleta).
Dated: in rags.
Low: shameless person.
Low: drunkard.
The upper section of the river, characterized by the highest gradients and, respectively, the highest velocities of water flow.
suffix:
реки сочинил
  И сплавил в низо

text: Downstream, close to the river mouth. So he must have been sailing down the river.
prefix:
вьях реки сочинил
  И сплавил в

text: Colloquial: to have fun, to relax. The frequent use of the verb *gulyat'* is linked to the fact that, in chapter 10, Orina is defined as gulyaschaya: "была у нас Оря гулена, а стала гулящая" (R220/E124). In her case, "гулена" means "party person" and "гулящая" is used to describe a woman with chaotic romantic relationships.
Generally, to go caroling, but here, to revel and drink. Alcohol theme.
Low: excess, surplus.
Instead of a more common "mirror," he takes a look at himself reflected on a mug. Alcohol theme.
suffix:
— а ты уж удод.
  Хреново, худы

text: Here, Yakov avoids the expected rhyme "урод" (monster, ugly person, deformity). The hoopoe appears several times throughout the novel, mostly in Yakov's poems (R167, 168, 169, 233, 236, 262, 280/E31, 32, 33, 34, 35, 145, 149, 199). Pictured here: ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/0/06/Upupa_epops_Madrid_01.jpg) Animal motif.
prefix: Посмотришься в кружку — а ты уж

text: Vulgar: really bad.
prefix: шься в кружку — а ты уж удод.

text: Set expression: худые дела (just no good, all is terrible).
prefix:
ужку — а ты уж удод.
  Хреново,

text: Time before spring. A continuation of the temporal setting: autumn shifting into winter (again).
Darning. Sewing motif.
Dialectical: fish net. Pictured here: ![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/7/7c/Fuiken.jpg)

  Но знаю — набухнут и

text: Colloquial: stealthily, on the sly.
prefix:
и и бочки,
  Но знаю — набухнут

text: Low: pushy, aggressive, insolent.
Leaf bud. Plant motif. Might also be be read as a reference to kidneys and to drinking (too much will be poured into their bodies). Alcohol theme.
Set expression: fool, dumb person.
